title: 4 signs of emotional abuse - Viann Nguyen-Feng

multiple-choice.question: What is emotional abuse?

options.label: B
options.text: A form of emotional manipulation that can increase a person's chances of developing depression and anxiety

multiple-choice.question: What is a common sign of emotional abuse?

options.label: A
options.text: Criticism that is out of proportion to a situation

options.label: B
options.text: A person who is always happy and positive

options.label: C
options.text: A person who is always willing to listen

options.label: D
options.text: A person who is always willing to compromise

multiple-choice.question: What is gaslighting?

options.label: B
options.text: A form of emotional manipulation that involves undermining someone's perceptions of events

multiple-choice.question: Why is it essential to recognize emotional abuse?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it's a serious issue that can have long-lasting effects on a person's mental health

options.label: B
options.text: Because it's a minor issue that can be easily ignored

options.label: C
options.text: Because it's a personal issue that only affects the person experiencing it

options.label: D
options.text: Because it's a societal issue that affects everyone

multiple-choice.question: What can you do if you think you or someone you care about is experiencing emotional abuse?

options.label: A
options.text: Ignore the situation and hope it goes away

options.label: B
options.text: Seek local or national confidential advocacy centers that can provide helpful resources

options.label: C
options.text: Confront the abuser and try to resolve the issue on your own

options.label: D
options.text: Report the abuser to the authorities

options.label: A
options.text: Because it's a way to isolate the abuser and make them feel alone

options.label: B
options.text: Because it's a way to support the person experiencing emotional abuse and provide them with a safe and supportive environment

options.label: C
options.text: Because it's a way to confront the abuser and try to resolve the issue on your own

options.label: D
options.text: Because it's a way to report the abuser to the authorities

multiple-choice.question: What is a characteristic of an abuser?

options.label: A
options.text: They are always kind and respectful

options.label: B
options.text: They rarely engage in abusive behaviors 100% of the time

options.label: C
options.text: They are always willing to listen

options.label: D
options.text: They are always happy and positive

multiple-choice.question: Why is it essential to recognize that moments of kindness or calm don't invalidate moments of abuse?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it's a way to minimize the impact of the abuse

options.label: B
options.text: Because it's a way to justify the abuser's behavior

options.label: C
options.text: Because it's a way to acknowledge that abuse can be cyclical and that moments of kindness or calm don't necessarily mean the abuse has stopped

options.label: D
options.text: Because it's a way to ignore the abuse and hope it goes away

multiple-choice.question: What is a common way that abusers try to isolate their targets?

options.label: B
options.text: By being overly critical and dismissive

options.label: C
options.text: By being overly flattering and charming

options.label: D
options.text: By being overly aggressive and confrontational

multiple-choice.question: Why is it essential to recognize that nobody deserves to be mistreated?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it's a way to justify the abuser's behavior

options.label: B
options.text: Because it's a way to minimize the impact of the abuse

options.label: C
options.text: Because it's a way to acknowledge that everyone deserves kindness and respect

options.label: D
options.text: Because it's a way to ignore the abuse and hope it goes away

title: What really happened during the Attica Prison Rebellion - Orisanmi Burton

multiple-choice.question: What was the primary reason for the Attica Prison Rebellion?

options.label: A
options.text: The prisoners wanted to escape from the prison.

options.label: B
options.text: The prisoners were dissatisfied with the harsh conditions and mistreatment they faced at Attica prison.

options.label: C
options.text: The prisoners wanted to overthrow the government.

options.label: D
options.text: The prisoners were seeking revenge against the guards.

multiple-choice.question: Who were some of the leaders of the Attica Prison Rebellion?

options.label: A
options.text: Elliott Barkley, Frank Smith, and Herbert X. Blyden

multiple-choice.question: What were some of the demands made by the prisoners during the Attica Prison Rebellion?

options.label: A
options.text: A minimum wage, rehabilitation programs, and better education

options.label: B
options.text: An end to the physical and verbal abuse they suffered at the hands of white guards

options.label: C
options.text: Amnesty for crimes committed during the uprising

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the siege at Attica prison?

options.label: A
options.text: The prisoners were able to negotiate a peaceful resolution.

options.label: B
options.text: The prisoners were able to escape from the prison.

options.label: C
options.text: The siege resulted in the deaths of 29 prisoners and 10 guards.

options.label: D
options.text: The siege resulted in the imprisonment of many more prisoners.

multiple-choice.question: What was the aftermath of the Attica Prison Rebellion?

options.label: A
options.text: The prisoners were able to return to their normal lives.

options.label: B
options.text: The prisoners were subjected to torture, deprivation of medical attention, and other forms of mistreatment.

options.label: C
options.text: The event had no impact on the prisoners or their supporters.

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of the Attica Prison Rebellion on the prisoners and their supporters?

options.label: A
options.text: The event had no impact on the prisoners or their supporters.

options.label: B
options.text: The event galvanized the prisoners and their supporters, who continued to fight for revolutionary change and social justice.

options.label: C
options.text: The event led to the imprisonment of many more prisoners.

options.label: D
options.text: The event resulted in the escape of many prisoners.

multiple-choice.question: Who was the Governor of New York at the time of the Attica Prison Rebellion?
What was the role of President Nixon in the Attica Prison Rebellion?

options.label: A
options.text: President Nixon was a supporter of the prisoners and their demands.

options.label: B
options.text: President Nixon was a critic of the prisoners and their demands.

options.label: C
options.text: President Nixon congratulated Governor Rockefeller on the "beautiful operation".

options.label: D
options.text: President Nixon had no involvement in the Attica Prison Rebellion.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the autopsies on the guards who died during the siege?

options.label: A
options.text: The autopsies confirmed that the prisoners had killed the guards.

options.label: B
options.text: The autopsies confirmed that the government forces had killed the guards.

multiple-choice.question: What is the legacy of the Attica Prison Rebellion?

options.label: A
options.text: The event was quickly forgotten and had no impact on the prisoners or their supporters.

options.label: B
options.text: The event galvanized the prisoners and their supporters, who continued to fight for revolutionary change and social justice.

options.label: C
options.text: The event led to the imprisonment of many more prisoners.

options.label: D
options.text: The event resulted in the escape of many prisoners.
